summary.para: Installs a new advise sink from the interface or modifies an existing advise sink. The sink interface is specified by the punk parameter.

param.name: riid
param.para: Specifies the sink interface.

param.name: punk
param.para: Pointer to the sink interface. Cannot be NULL.

param.name: dwMask
param.para: Specifies the events that notify the advise sink. For more information about possible parameter values, see TS_AS_* Constants.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The method was successful.
A sink interface pointer could not be obtained.
The specified sink interface is unsupported.
The specified sink object could not be obtained.

summary.para: Determines the character position where a transition occurs in an attribute value. The specified attribute to check is application-dependent.

param.name: acpStart
param.para: Specifies the character position to start the search for an attribute transition.

param.name: acpHalt
param.para: Specifies the character position to end the search for an attribute transition.

param.name: cFilterAttrs
param.para: Specifies the number of attributes to check.

param.name: paFilterAttrs
param.para: Pointer to the TS_ATTRID data type that specifies the attribute to check.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: Specifies the direction to search for an attribute transition. By default, the method searches forward.

description.para: The method searches backward.
The plFoundOffset parameter receives the character offset of the attribute transition from acpStart.

param.name: pacpNext
param.para: Receives the next character position to check for an attribute transition.

param.name: pfFound
param.para: Receives a Boolean value of TRUE if an attribute transition was found, otherwise FALSE is returned.

param.name: plFoundOffset
param.para: Receives the character position of the attribute transition (not ACP positions). If TS_ATTR_FIND_WANT_OFFSET flag is set in dwFlags, receives the character offset of the attribute transition from acpStart.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The method was successful.
The character positions specified are beyond the text in the document.

remarks.para: Note If an application does not implement FindNextAttrTransition, fails with E_FAIL.

summary.para: Converts a point in screen coordinates to an application character position.

param.name: vcView
param.para: Specifies the context view.

param.name: ptScreen
param.para: Pointer to the POINT structure with the screen coordinates of the point.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: Specifies the character position to return based upon the screen coordinates of the point relative to a character bounding box. By default, the character position returned is the character bounding box containing the screen coordinates of the point. If the point is outside a character bounding box, the method returns NULL or TF_E_INVALIDPOINT. Other bit flags for this parameter are as follows.
The bit flags can be combined.

description.para: If the screen coordinates of the point are contained in a character bounding box, the character position returned is the bounding edge closest to the screen coordinates of the point.
If the screen coordinates of the point are not contained in a character bounding box, the closest character position is returned.

param.name: pacp
param.para: Receives the character position that corresponds to the screen coordinates of the point.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The method was successful.
The ptScreen parameter is not within the bounding box of any character.
The application has not calculated a text layout.

summary.para: Gets a TsViewCookie that represents the current active view.

param.name: pvcView
param.para: Receives the TsViewCookie data type that specifies the current active view.

returns.para: This method has no return values.

summary.para: Gets an embedded document.

param.name: acpPos
param.para: Contains the character position, within the document, from where the object is obtained.

param.name: rguidService
param.para: Contains a GUID value that defines the requested format of the obtained object. This can be one of the following values.

description.para: The object should be obtained as an object.
The object should be obtained as an Accessible object.
The object should be obtained as an ActiveX object.

param.name: riid
param.para: Specifies the interface type requested.

param.name: ppunk
param.para: Pointer to an IUnknown pointer that receives the requested interface.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The method was successful.
One or more parameters are invalid.
The application does not support embedded objects.

item.description: acpPos is not within the document.

description.para: The requested interface type is unsupported.
The caller does not have a read-only lock.
There is no embedded object at acpPos.
The service type specified in rguidService is unsupported.

remarks.para: Use to probe for appropriate interfaces. Prospective interfaces include those associated with embedded documents or controls such as IOleObject , IDataObject , IViewObject , IPersistStorage , IOleCache , or IDispatch .

summary.para: Gets the number of characters in a document.

param.name: pacp
param.para: Receives the character position of the last character in the document plus one.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The method was successful.

The application has not implemented this method. This is usually an indication that calculating the end position requires excessive resources. If the end position is necessary, you can use to calculate it, though this can also be a memory-intensive operation, paging in arbitrarily large amounts of memory from disk.
The caller does not have a read-only lock.

summary.para: Gets formatted text data about a specified text string. The caller must have a read/write lock on the document before calling this method.

param.name: acpStart
param.para: Specifies the starting character position of the text to get in the document.

param.name: acpEnd
param.para: Specifies the ending character position of the text to get in the document. This parameter is ignored if the value is 1.

param.name: ppDataObject
param.para: Receives the pointer to the object that contains the formatted text.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The method was successful.
The caller does not have a read/write lock on the document.

summary.para: Gets the bounding box screen coordinates of the display surface where the text stream is rendered.

param.name: vcView
param.para: Specifies the context view.

param.name: prc
param.para: Receives the bounding box screen coordinates of the display surface of the document.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The method was successful.
The specified vcView parameter is invalid.

remarks.para: If the text is not currently displayed, for example, if the document window is minimized, the prc parameter is set to { 0, 0, 0, 0 }.

summary.para: Gets the character position of a text selection in a document. This method supports multiple text selections. The caller must have a read-only lock on the document before calling this method.

param.name: ulIndex
param.para: Specifies the text selections that start the process. If the TF_DEFAULT_SELECTION constant is specified for this parameter, the input selection starts the process.

param.name: ulCount
param.para: Specifies the maximum number of selections to return.

param.name: pSelection
param.para: Receives the style, start, and end character positions of the selected text. These values are put into the structure.

param.name: pcFetched
param.para: Receives the number of pSelection structures returned.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The method was successful.
The caller does not have a read-only lock on the document.
The document has no selection.

summary.para: Gets the document status. The document status is returned through the structure.

param.name: pdcs
param.para: Receives the structure that contains the document status. Cannot be NULL.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The method was successful.
The pointer to the parameter is invalid.

summary.para: Gets info about text at a specified character position. This method returns the visible and hidden text and indicates if embedded data is attached to the text.

param.name: acpStart
param.para: Specifies the starting character position.

param.name: acpEnd
param.para: Specifies the ending character position. If this parameter is 1, then return all text in the text store.

param.name: pchPlain
param.para: Specifies the buffer to receive the plain text data. If this parameter is NULL, then the cchPlainReq parameter must be 0.

param.name: cchPlainReq
param.para: Specifies the number of plain text characters passed to the method.

param.name: pcchPlainRet
param.para: Receives the number of characters copied into the plain text buffer. This parameter cannot be NULL. Use a parameter if values are not required.

param.name: prgRunInfo
param.para: Receives an array of structures. May be NULL only if cRunInfoReq = 0.

param.name: cRunInfoReq
param.para: Specifies the size, in characters, of the text run buffer.

param.name: pcRunInfoRet
param.para: Receives the number of TS_RUNINFO structures written to the text run buffer. This parameter cannot be NULL.

param.name: pacpNext
param.para: Receives the character position of the next unread character. Cannot be NULL.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The method was successful.
The acpStart or acpEnd parameters are outside of the document text.
The caller does not have a read-only lock on the document.

remarks.para: Callers that use this method must have a read-only lock on the document by calling the method. Without a read-only lock, the method fails and returns TF_E_NOLOCK.

Applications can also truncate the method return values for internal reasons. Callers should carefully examine the return characters and text run counts to get the required return values. If the return values are incomplete, repeatedly call the method until the return values are complete.

The caller can request plain text only by setting the cRunInfoReq parameter to 0 and the prgRunInfo parameter to NULL. The caller can request only text run data by setting the cchPlainReq parameter to 0 and the pchPlain parameter to NULL. However, the caller must still supply valid non-null values for pcchPlainRet, even if this parameter is not used.
If acpEnd is -1, then it should be handled as if set at the end of the stream. Otherwise, it will be greater than or equal to zero.

On exit, pacpNext should be set to the character position of the next character in the stream not referenced by the return values. A caller would use this to quickly scan text with multiple GetText calls.

summary.para: Gets the bounding box, in screen coordinates, of the text at a specified character position. The caller must have a read-only lock on the document before calling this method.

param.name: vcView
param.para: Specifies the context view.

param.name: acpStart
param.para: Specifies the starting character position of the text to get in the document.

param.name: acpEnd
param.para: Specifies the ending character position of the text to get in the document.

param.name: prc
param.para: Receives the bounding box in screen coordinates of the text at the specified character positions.

param.name: pfClipped
param.para: Receives a Boolean value that specifies if the text in the bounding box has been clipped. If this parameter is TRUE, the bounding box contains clipped text and does not include the entire requested text range. The bounding box is clipped because the requested range is not visible.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The method was successful.
The specified start and end character positions are equal.
The range specified by the acpStart and acpEnd parameters extends past the beginning or end of the document.
The application has not calculated a text layout.
The caller does not have a read-only lock on the document.

remarks.para: If the document window is minimized, or if the specified text is not currently visible, the method returns S_OK with the prc parameter set to {0,0,0,0}.

summary.para: Inserts an embedded object at the specified character.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: Must be TS_IE_CORRECTION.

param.name: acpStart
param.para: Contains the starting character position where the object is inserted.

param.name: acpEnd
param.para: Contains the ending character position where the object is inserted.

param.name: pDataObject
param.para: Pointer to an interface that contains data about the object inserted.

param.name: pChange
param.para: Pointer to a structure that receives data about the modified text.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The method was successful.
One or more parameters are invalid.
The application does not support embedded objects.
The application does not support the data type contained in pDataObject.

item.description: acpStart and/or acpEnd are not within the document.

description.para: The caller does not have a read/write lock.

summary.para: Inserts an at the insertion point or selection. The client that calls this method must have a read/write lock before inserting an object into the document.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: Specifies whether the pacpStart and pacpEnd parameters and the structure will contain the results of the object insertion.
The TF_IAS_NOQUERY and TF_IAS_QUERYONLY flags cannot be combined.

description.para: Text insertion will occur, and the pacpStart and pacpEnd parameters will contain the results of the text insertion. The structure must be filled with this flag.
Text is inserted, the values of the pacpStart and pacpEnd parameters can be NULL, and the structure must be filled. Use this flag if the results of the text insertion are not required.

Text is not inserted, and the values for the pacpStart and pacpEnd parameter contain the results of the text insertion. The values of these parameters depend on how the application implements text insertion into a document. For more information, see the Remarks section.

Use this flag to view the results of the text insertion without actually inserting the text, for example, to predict the results of collapsing or otherwise adjusting a selection. It is not required that you fill the structure with this flag.

param.name: pDataObject
param.para: Pointer to the object to be inserted.

param.name: pacpStart
param.para: Pointer to the starting application character position where the object insertion will occur.

param.name: pacpEnd
param.para: Pointer to the ending application character position where the object insertion will occur. This parameter value will be the same as the value of the pacpStart parameter for an insertion point.

param.name: pChange
param.para: Pointer to a structure with the following members.

description.para: The starting application character position before the object is inserted into the document.

The ending application character position before the object is inserted into the document. This value is the same as acpStart for an insertion point. If this value is different from acpStart, then text was selected prior to the object insertion.
The ending application character position after the object insertion took place.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The method was successful.
The pchText parameter is invalid.
The caller does not have a lock on the document.

remarks.para: The values of the pacpStart and pacpEnd parameters depend upon how the client application inserts an object into a document. For example, if the application sets the cursor at the start of the object after object insertion, then the value of the pacpStart and pacpEnd parameters is the same as the acpStart member of the structure.

summary.para: Inserts text at the insertion point or selection. A caller must have a read/write lock on the document before inserting text.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: The values of the pacpStart and the pacpEnd parameters depend upon how the client application inserts text into a document. For example, if the application sets the cursor at the start of the inserted text after text insertion, then the value for the pacpStart and pacpEnd parameters is the same as the acpStart member of the structure.
Applications should not call the method in response to this method.

summary.para: Determines whether the specified start and end character positions are valid. Use this method to adjust an edit to a document before executing the edit. The method must not return values outside the range of the document.

param.name: acpTestStart
param.para: Starting application character position for inserted text.

param.name: acpTestEnd
param.para: Ending application character position for the inserted text. This value is equal to acpTextStart if the text is inserted at a point instead of replacing selected text.

param.name: cch
param.para: Length of replacement text.

param.name: pacpResultStart
param.para: Returns the new starting application character position of the inserted text. If this parameter is NULL, then text cannot be inserted at the specified position. This value cannot be outside the document range.

param.name: pacpResultEnd
param.para: Returns the new ending application character position of the inserted text. If this parameter is NULL, then pacpResultStart is set to NULL and text cannot be inserted at the specified position. This value cannot be outside the document range.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The method was successful.
An unspecified error occurred.
The acpTestStart or acpTestEnd parameters are invalid.

remarks.para: The values of pacpResultStart and pacpResultEnd depend upon how the application inserts text into the document. If pacpResultStart and pacpResultEnd are the same as acpTextStart, the cursor is at the beginning of the inserted text after insertion. If pacpResultStart and pacpResultEnd are the same as acpTextEnd, the cursor is at the end of the inserted text after insertion. If the difference between pacpResultStart and pacpResultEnd is equal to the length of the inserted text, the inserted text is highlighted after insertion.

summary.para: Gets a value indicating whether the specified object can be inserted into the document.

param.name: pguidService
param.para: Pointer to the object type. Can be NULL.

param.name: pFormatEtc
param.para: Pointer to the structure that contains format data of the object. This parameter cannot be NULL if the pguidService parameter is NULL.

param.name: pfInsertable
param.para: Receives TRUE if the object type can be inserted into the document or FALSE if the object type can't be inserted into the document.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The method was successful.
The pFormatEtc parameter is NULL.

remarks.para: The clipboard formats supported by the document are dependent on the application.

summary.para: Gets text attributes at the specified character position.

param.name: acpPos
param.para: Specifies the application character position in the document.

param.name: cFilterAttrs
param.para: Specifies the number of attributes to obtain.

param.name: paFilterAttrs
param.para: Pointer to the TS_ATTRID data type that specifies the attribute to verify.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: Specifies attributes for the call to the method. If this parameter is not set, the method returns the attributes that start at the specified position. Other possible values for this parameter are the following.

description.para: Obtains the attributes that end at the specified application character position.
Obtains the value of the attribute in addition to the attribute. The attribute value is put into the varValue member of the structure during the method call.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The method was successful.

remarks.para: In the sentence, "This is italic text.", the italic attribute starts before the word italic and ends after the word text.
If the flag TS_ATTR_FIND_WANT_END is set in dwFlags, the method would return the italic attribute for the text "italic <anchor>normal", because there is an end transition at the anchor location.

summary.para: Gets text attributes transitioning at the specified character position.

param.name: acpPos
param.para: Specifies the application character position in the document.

param.name: cFilterAttrs
param.para: Specifies the number of attributes to obtain.

param.name: paFilterAttrs
param.para: Pointer to the TS_ATTRID data type that specifies the attribute to verify.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: Specifies attributes for the call to the method. If this parameter is not set, the method returns the attributes that start at the specified position. Other possible values for this parameter are the following.

description.para: Obtains the attributes that end at the specified application character position.
Obtains the value of the attribute in addition to the attribute. The attribute value is put into the varValue member of the structure during the method call.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The method was successful.

remarks.para: In the sentence, "This is italic text.", the italic attribute starts before the word italic and ends after the word text.
If the flag TS_ATTR_FIND_WANT_END is set in dwFlags, the method would return the italic attribute for the text "italic <anchor>normal", because there is an end transition at the anchor location.

summary.para: Called by the TSF manager to provide a document lock in order to modify the document. This method calls the method to create the document lock.

param.name: dwLockFlags
param.para: Specifies the type of lock requested.

description.para: The document has a read-only lock and cannot be modified.
The document has a read/write lock and can be modified.
The document has a synchronous-lock if this flag is combined with other flags.

param.name: phrSession
param.para: If the lock request is synchronous, receives an HRESULT value from the method that specifies the result of the lock request.

If the lock request is asynchronous and the result is TS_S_ASYNC, the document receives an asynchronous lock. If the lock request is asynchronous and the result is TS_E_SYNCHRONOUS, the document can't be locked synchronously.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The method was successful.
An unspecified error occurred.

remarks.para: This method uses the method to lock the document. Applications must never modify the document or send change notifications using the method from within the RequestLock method. If the application has pending changes to report, the application can only respond to the asynchronous lock request.

Applications should not attempt to queue multiple RequestLock method calls, because the application requires only a single callback. If the caller makes several read requests and one or more write requests, however, the callback should be for write access.

Successful requests for synchronous locks supersede requests for asynchronous locks. Unsuccessful requests for synchronous locks do not supersede requests for asynchronous locks. The implementation must still serve the outstanding asynchronous request, if one exists.

If the lock is granted before the RequestLock method returns, the phrSession parameter will receive the HRESULT returned by the method. If the call is successful, but the lock will be granted later, the phrSession parameter receives the TS_S_ASYNC flag. The phrSession parameter should be ignored if RequestLock returns anything other than S_OK.

A caller should never call this method reentrantly, except in the case that the caller holds a read-only lock. In this case the method can be called reentrantly to ask for an asynchronous write lock. The write lock will be granted later, after the read-only lock ends.
For more information about document locks, see Document Locks.

summary.para: Get the attributes that are supported in the document.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: Specifies whether a subsequent call to the method will contain the supported attributes. If the TS_ATTR_FIND_WANT_VALUE flag is specified, the default attribute values will be those in the structure after the subsequent call to RetrieveRequestedAttrs. If any other flag is specified for this parameter, the method only verifies that the attribute is supported and that the varValue member of the TS_ATTRVAL structure is set to VT_EMPTY.

param.name: cFilterAttrs
param.para: Specifies the number of supported attributes to obtain.

param.name: paFilterAttrs
param.para: Pointer to the TS_ATTRID data type that specifies the attribute to verify. The method returns only the attributes specified by TS_ATTRID, even though other attributes can be supported.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The method was successful.
An unspecified error occurred.
The method was unable to allocate sufficient memory to complete the operation.

summary.para: Gets the attributes returned by a call to an attribute request method.

param.name: ulCount
param.para: Specifies the number of supported attributes to obtain.

param.name: paAttrVals
param.para: Pointer to the structure that receives the supported attributes. The members of this structure depend upon the dwFlags parameter of the calling method.

param.name: pcFetched
param.para: Receives the number of supported attributes.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The method was successful.

summary.para: Selects text within the document. The application must have a read/write lock on the document before calling this method.

param.name: ulCount
param.para: Specifies the number of text selections in pSelection.

param.name: pSelection
param.para: Specifies the style, start, and end character positions of the text selected through the structure.
When the start and end character positions are equal, the method places a caret at that character position. There can be only one caret at a time in the document.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The method was successful.
An unspecified error occurred.
The character positions specified are beyond the text in the document.
The caller does not have a read/write lock.

summary.para: Sets the text selection to the supplied character positions.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: If set to the value of TS_ST_CORRECTION, the text is a transform (correction) of existing content, and any special text markup information (metadata) is retained, such as .wav file data or a language identifier. The client defines the type of markup information to be retained.

param.name: acpStart
param.para: Specifies the starting character position of the text to replace.

param.name: acpEnd
param.para: Specifies the ending character position of the text to replace. This parameter is ignored if the value is 1.

param.name: pchText
param.para: Specifies the pointer to the replacement text. The text string does not have to be NULL terminated, because the text character count is specified in the cch parameter.

param.name: cch
param.para: Specifies the number of characters in the replacement text.

param.name: pChange
param.para: Pointer to a structure with the following data.

description.para: The starting application character position before the text is inserted into the document.

The ending position before the text is inserted into the document. This value is the same as acpStart for an insertion point. If this value is different from acpStart, then text was selected prior to the text insertion.
The ending position after the text insertion occurred.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The method was successful.
The acpStart or acpEnd parameter is outside of the document text.
The caller does not have a read/write lock.
The document is read-only. Content cannot be modified.
An attempt was made to modify text across a region boundary.

remarks.para: Applications should start a composition by first using . SetText should be used only within an existing composition. If there is no active composition at the time SetText is called, the TSF manager creates a composition that lasts just long enough to wrap the call to SetText.
The acpStart and acpEnd character positions cannot be outside the document range.
Applications should not call the method in response to this method.
This method should call the method to select the text to be changed. After successfully executing the SetSelection method, this method then calls the method to perform the actual text change.

summary.para: Called by an application to indicate that it no longer requires notifications from the TSF manager. The TSF manager will release the sink interface and stop notifications.

param.name: punk
param.para: Pointer to a sink object. Cannot be NULL.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The method was successful.
There is no active sink object.

remarks.para: Every call to the method, which registers a new sink object, should be matched by a call to this method. Calls to the AdviseSink method that only update the dwMask parameter of a sink which was previously registered, do not require a call to the UnadviseSink method.

For example, to register a sink object, an application calls the method the first time. After registering the sink object, the application can call the AdviseSink method again with the same sink object to change the dwMask parameter. To unregister the sink object, an application calls the UnadviseSink method.
The punk parameter must have the same COM identity as the pointer originally passed in the method.

summary.para: The ITextStoreACP2 interface is implemented by the application and is used by the TSF manager to manipulate text streams or text stores in TSF. An application can obtain an instance of this interface with a call to the method. The interface ID is IID_ITextStoreACP2.
This interface exposes text stores through an application character position (ACP) format. Applications that use an anchor-based format should use .
